pullRequest.body:
---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [15a3810b7d](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/16818/commits/15a3810b7d3c3c78b45fbe8b336393dcc757be1c)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.Data.List.GroupBy`|283|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ chain'_getLast_head_groupBy`
`+ chain'_of_mem_groupBy`
`+ groupBy_nil`
`+ join_groupBy`
`+ ne_nil_of_mem_groupBy`
`+ nil_not_mem_groupBy`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

This property is proven in #16837. I separated it from this PR since it's 100 or so extra lines of code (and it depends on a few lemmas that have only been added to the newest version of core Lean).

We have to prove these lemmas in order to even prove that property, so golfing is out of the question.

:v: vihdzp can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11339709963/job/31534948393)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11339709963/job/31534948744)

Can we have the lemmas that `l.groupBy r = l.map ([.]) \iff l.Chain' (\not r . .)` and `L.join.groupBy r = L` if `L` respects the obvious conditions? I'm asking because these lemmas should be excessively easy to prove once you have the "universal property" of `List.groupBy`, namely that if the obvious properties on `L` hold then `l.groupBy r = L \iff l = L.join` (or more generally `l.groupBy r = L \iff obvious properties on L and l = L.join`. I don't think you have that yet.

Can we have the lemmas that `l.groupBy r = l.map ([.]) \iff l.Chain' (\not r . .)` and `L.join.groupBy r = L` if `L` respects the obvious conditions? I'm asking because these lemmas should be excessively easy to prove once you have the "universal property" of `List.groupBy`, namely that if the obvious properties on `L` hold then `l.groupBy r = L \iff l = L.join` (or more generally `l.groupBy r = L \iff obvious properties on L and l = L.join`. I don't think you have that yet.
Should not have `ne` in the name.
Is `List.chain'_last_head_groupBy` better?
"reverse" both times.
This paragraph would be better as a doc-string on `loop`. PR welcome.
Reduce indent by two  here, is I think the preferred style.
Use `generalizing` instead of the revert/intro dance.
Nice! I hadn't quite grasped what that did until now.

```suggestion
      split <;> simp [IH]
```

You could probably give a version that doesn't require the existential, instead using `ne_nil_of_mem_groupBy`. However this might instead require using `.attach.Chain'`, so it wouldn't replace this one.
Is it ok if I add this once we update to a new version of core Lean?
(I asked this same question on Zulip and got yes for an answer, I've made PR #17044 which adds this relevant lemma to the bump branch)

```suggestion
This file provides the basic API for `List.groupBy` which is defined in Core.
The main results are the following:
```

I know it's private but just in case it gets unprivated later might as well give it the correct name
```suggestion
private theorem groupByLoop_eq_append {r : α → α → Bool} {l : List α} {a : α} {g : List α}
```
Can you clarify in the module doc that it is grouping *consecutive* elements? I was expecting `groupBy (. = .) [1, 2, 1] = [[1, 1], [2]]`

```suggestion
theorem chain'_getLast_head_groupBy (r : α → α → Bool) (l : List α) :
```

Also add `groupBy_singleton`? Otherwise LGTM. Thanks!
bors d+
Unfortunately I don't think I can prove groupBy_singleton very easily yet. It's a two liner with the `groupBy_append` lemma in https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/16837, though.

```suggestion
- `List.chain'_getLast_head_groupBy`: the last element of each list in `List.groupBy` is not related
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Data/List/GroupBy): Basic API for `List.GroupBy`
